designScenario.name: Spoiler System
designScenario.description: The Spoiler System is a critical flight control subsystem responsible for modulating aerodynamic lift and drag during flight. It consists of deployable surfaces on the wings that disrupt airflow to reduce lift, enhance roll control, and assist in ground deceleration. The system operates in coordination with ailerons for roll augmentation, acts as speed brakes in-flight, and deploys fully as ground spoilers post-landing. Design priorities include rapid deployment, precise angular control, structural resilience under high aerodynamic loads, and seamless integration with flight control computers. The system incorporates redundancy, fault detection, and environmental hardening to ensure reliability across all flight phases.

details.description: Deploy spoiler panels asymmetrically to disrupt wing lift for roll control augmentation alongside ailerons.
Activate symmetrically as speed brakes to increase drag and reduce airspeed during flight.
Fully deploy ground spoilers upon landing to maximize wheel braking efficiency by eliminating residual lift.
Achieve full spoiler deployment (0° to 60° deflection) within 100 milliseconds under maximum aerodynamic load.
Maintain angular synchronization within ±0.5° between left/right spoiler pairs during asymmetric operation.
Sustain operation under shear stresses up to 1200 kPa during high-speed deployments.
Implement dual hydraulic actuators per spoiler panel with mechanical locking in stowed position upon hydraulic failure.
Integrate strain gauge arrays to detect jamming or over-torque conditions, triggering automatic retraction sequences.
Construct spoiler panels from carbon-fiber reinforced polymer (CFRP) with titanium leading edges to withstand >100,000 deployment cycles.
Apply erosion-resistant coatings to hinge mechanisms for operation in particulate-heavy environments.

systemComponents.name: Spoiler Assembly
systemComponents.description: Primary aerodynamic surfaces mounted on wing upper surfaces, mechanically linked to actuation systems.

subComponents.name: Spoiler Panel
subComponents.description: Aerodynamically profiled CFRP panel with integrated hinge points and load transfer fittings.

subComponents.name: Hinge Mechanism
subComponents.description: Low-friction rotary hinge with integrated position sensors and lubrication ports.

systemComponents.name: Dual Hydraulic Actuator
systemComponents.description: Redundant linear actuators converting hydraulic pressure into spoiler deflection torque.

subComponents.name: Piston Assembly
subComponents.description: Hardened steel piston with dual sealing rings and pressure-balanced design.

subComponents.name: Torque Tube
subComponents.description: Spline-coupled shaft transmitting actuator force to spoiler hinge points.

systemComponents.name: Spoiler Control Module (SCM)
systemComponents.description: Dual-channel computer processing flight control commands into actuator displacement signals.

subComponents.name: Command Interface
subComponents.description: ARINC 429/629 databus interface for receiving deployment demands from flight control computers.

subComponents.name: Actuator Drive Circuit
subComponents.description: Electro-hydraulic servo valves controlling hydraulic flow to actuators.

systemComponents.name: Load Monitoring Package
systemComponents.description: Distributed sensor suite measuring real-time aerodynamic forces on spoiler surfaces.

subComponents.name: Strain Gauge Array
subComponents.description: Rosette-pattern gauges detecting panel bending moments and shear forces.

subComponents.name: Accelerometer
subComponents.description: MEMS-based vibration sensor monitoring flutter tendencies during deployment.

relationships.description: The Spoiler Control Module (SCM) receives real-time deployment commands from the central Actuator Control Module via avionics databus protocols.
Spoiler assemblies are integrated into the wing structure as subordinate components of the broader Flight Surfaces system.
Each spoiler panel contains two permanently mounted hydraulic actuators that cannot function independently of the spoiler assembly.
Strain gauges and accelerometers are physically mounted on spoiler panels but operate as a logically separate monitoring system.

attributes.name: maxDeflectionAngle
attributes.description: Total angular travel range from fully stowed to maximum deployed position.

attributes.name: asymmetricSyncTolerance
attributes.description: Maximum permitted angular difference between left/right spoiler pairs during roll control operations.

attributes.name: deploymentForce
attributes.description: Operating hydraulic pressure required to overcome aerodynamic loads at maximum airspeed.

attributes.name: harmonicVibrationResistance
attributes.description: Vibration spectrum withstood without resonant structural failure during deployment.

attributes.name: temperatureOperatingRange
attributes.description: Ambient temperature limits for reliable mechanical operation, accounting for aerodynamic heating.

comments.body: Primary control interface for flight control computer integration
